body:
Comment 4: 
Why would constants be treated differently? They are read-only values. A variable
contains a value. A package does not. A package is a namespace. Many languages treat
namespaces differently.

Perhaps you could optionally use "#" as a prefix for a package name without specifying
it. So if you did`import "net/url"` you could use #url.Parse(...) or url.Parse(...). The
url.Parse(...) would not work if you used "url" as a variable but #url would still work.
